abstracts.cdata!:
The project would meet the growth in
            electricity demand until 1992 in the Antananarivo area, and
            provide for the strengthening of JIRAMA. The major
            components of the project include: (a) a concrete diversion
            dam 10 m high and 125 m long, and an intake structure; (b) a
            tunnel 5.2 m in diameter and 4 km long; an underground power
            house for four 28-MW units, and tailrace and access tunnels;
            (c) two turbines and two 28-MW generators; (d) electrical
            and mechanical equipment; (e) a 138-kV, 150-km, transmission
            line to Antananarivo; (f) engineering services; (g)
            reservoir at Ankorahotra; and (h) technical assistance and
            training of JIRAMA staff.
